item.title: Complexity Economics
item.description: https://www.inet.ox.ac.uk/research/programmes/complexity-economics/ Overview A growing number of economists and social scientists view the economy as a ‘complex adaptive system’ - a distributed network of dynamically interacting, heterogeneous agents, whose behaviours, strategies and relationships evolve over time.
